title: Word Jam
description: Join the Word Jam that takes place at 7pm on the second and fourth Sundays. Participants get 5 minutes to read a piece they have written

title: Fallen Leaves (Kuolleet lehdet)
description: FALLEN LEAVES is a luminous ode to romance and moviegoing. In modern-day Helsinki, two lonely souls in search of love meet by chance in a local karaoke bar. However, the pair’s path to happiness is beset by numerous obstacles – from lost numbers to mistaken addresses, alcoholism, and a charming stray dog. IN FINNISH W/ ENGLISH SUBTITLES

title: Mobilize | Art Inspiring Activism with Wild & Scenic Film Festival Exhibition
description: Mobilize is the first exhibition of 2026 under Art in Public Spaces and celebrates a 15-year partnership between Nevada County Arts Council and Wild & Scenic Film Festival. This year’s festival theme and title of the Rood Center exhibition, MOBILIZE, serves as a call to action and a celebration of progress toward tangible change. The exhibition explores Wild and Scenic’s rich history and its visual art exhibition, utilizing visual language to elevate voices, organize efforts, and address environmental challenges.

title: Nevada City Odd Fellows Open Mic
description: The most relaxed, most welcoming open mic in Western Nevada County

title: Good Morning Truckee
description: NEW!! ONLINE PRE-REGISTRATION at TruckeeChamber.com. Bring your receipt with you and breeze through the Express Check-In Line to get your breakfast and seat faster!, Hear from Jameson Stafford of Elevate Blue, Andy Scott of 1Bios and Johannes Ziegler of Tahoe Silicon Mountain on Truckee's Start-Up Scene and Tech Community.

title: Mobilize | Art Inspiring Activism with Wild & Scenic Film Festival Exhibition
description: Mobilize is the first exhibition of 2026 under Art in Public Spaces and celebrates a 15-year partnership between Nevada County Arts Council and Wild & Scenic Film Festival. This year’s festival theme and title of the Rood Center exhibition, MOBILIZE, serves as a call to action and a celebration of progress toward tangible change. The exhibition explores Wild and Scenic’s rich history and its visual art exhibition, utilizing visual language to elevate voices, organize efforts, and address environmental challenges.

title: African Drum and Dance of Nevada County
description: Come join our vibrant African Drum and Dance classes! Open to all ages and abilities, we explore different styles from across the African Diasporic disciplines. Including Malian, Congolese, Guinean, Senegalese, Afro-Cuban and Afro-Brazilian. Masters of their craft travel from all over to share their culture and heritage with our beautiful community, along with our own fabulous local teachers and percussionists, to offer a truly inspiring and engaging experience

title: Cosplay Curious: Teen Mixed Media Art Club
description: Cosplay Curious: Teen Mixed Media Art Club and Creative Get Together, A bi-monthly youth art group at The Curious Forge, Come as you are. Make something bold. Meet other creative teens., This bi-monthly Teen Art Club is a welcoming, inclusive creative meetup for youth ages 14–19 who are interested in art, cosplay, mixed media, and hands-on making. Facilitated by artist Clara Frawley, this group blends art-making, skill-sharing, and community connection in a relaxed, supportive environment., Each bi-monthly meetup will blend creative warm-ups, hands-on making, and skill-building in a relaxed, social studio environment. Participants will explore drawing, design, pattern-making, and mixed-media techniques while developing personal and collaborative projects. Sessions may include playful identity-based art, wearable or sculptural forms, safe tool and material use, and opportunities for skill sharing. As the group grows, projects will evolve based on shared interests and creative curiosity., No prior experience required—just curiosity and a willingness to try something new. We take great care to create a welcoming and inclusive environment where every person can feel valued and supported., Reserve your space with Ticket. , $10 donation recommended. No one will be turned away for lack of funds.

title: Julie Fowlis
description: Julie Fowlis is a multi-award-winning Scottish singer whose pure, crystalline voice has been celebrated around the world. Raised in the Outer Hebrides and deeply rooted in Gaelic tradition, her music is shaped by the landscapes and language of the Highlands., Internationally known as the voice of Disney Pixar’s Brave, Fowlis sang the film’s iconic theme songs — one of which was long-listed for an Oscar. Her career spans acclaimed solo albums, high-profile collaborations, and performances at major venues including Carnegie Hall, the Royal Albert Hall Proms, the Philharmonie de Paris, Shakespeare’s Globe, and global events broadcast to audiences of millions., Her voice has been streamed over 120 million times, featured on a NASA astronaut playlist, and even inspired a lily named in her honor. A sought-after collaborator and presenter, she has worked across film, television, radio, and video games — including How to Train Your Dragon 3 and Assassin’s Creed Valhalla., Fowlis was named Scotland’s first National Gaelic Ambassador, holds an honorary Doctorate of Music, and continues to champion Gaelic arts on the world stage.

title: Mobilize | Art Inspiring Activism with Wild & Scenic Film Festival Exhibition
description: Mobilize is the first exhibition of 2026 under Art in Public Spaces and celebrates a 15-year partnership between Nevada County Arts Council and Wild & Scenic Film Festival. title: Nevada City Winery Gallery "SÝN" - "VISION" by Lilja Gudmundsdottir
description: This series vividly shows reflective water, light, boulders, plant life, banks, and rich colors, but Lilja’s talents shine in her capturing of the river’s hidden jeweled views. She does so by literally going knee deep, camera in hand exploring over, under, and around to find the mysteries of immense boulders, crevasses, cracks, or wisps of branches seemingly embracing, and reaching for a softly lit boulder. The shows runs through February 23 - the winery is open every day. www.ncwinery.com.

title: Paint Empty Bowls for the Hospitality House Fundraiser – Happy Hour!
description: Join us at The Curious Forge and Paint some ceramic bowls for the Hospitality House Empty Bowl Fundraiser!, Open to the public and members! You are encouraged to bring a friend! Be sure to obtain tickets for each person joining us so we will have enough space for all., Happy hour – Paint bowls for Empty Bowls!, Drop in between 3:00 and 7:00 PM on Tue 2/3 and Wed 2/11. Obtain a free ticket so we know to expect you!, We’ll provide the bowls and glaze, you provide the creativity., First come first served, as long as the bowls last. Come be part of this great community fundraiser.

title: Playwriting Group
description: Sent upon request. (We meet in each other's homes.) All playwrights welcome! Whether playwriting is new to you or you're already an accomplished playwright, come join this on-going bi-weekly writers' group. We'll spend our time focusing on our writing, but with that magical element of doing so within the presence of others. Come discover the amazing experience of writing within the context of a group. Bring your computer, notebook, iPad, or whatever you like to use for writing. We share resources, discuss our goals and challenges, even provide feedback, but the primary focus of the group is to work on your own play! We'll do a check-in/discussion at the beginning of the meeting, then write in silence, and check-out at the end of our session. Contact Kimberly for the location and to answer any questions you may have.

title: Mobilize | Art Inspiring Activism with Wild & Scenic Film Festival Exhibition
description: Mobilize is the first exhibition of 2026 under Art in Public Spaces and celebrates a 15-year partnership between Nevada County Arts Council and Wild & Scenic Film Festival. title: Nevada City Winery Live Music with Cello Joe
description: Joey Chang aka Cello Joe is an anomaly in the world of cellists. He plays the cello while beatboxing, looping, and singing. His lyrics weave together sustainability, environmental justice, and social awareness.

title: February Creatives Meetup with KVMR!
description: We'll have a chance to meet local DJs, mingle with friends, and hear what's on the horizon for Nevada County Arts Council and the GVNC Cultural District., Our meetups are for everyone - whether you're an artist or an arts enthusiast - to support and uplift the creative community of our cultural district!

title: BriarPatch Food Co-op Co-Hosts: Heart & Seoul: Korean Street Food Cooking Class with Winnie Superette
description: Join us for an evening of mouthwatering flavors and cultural traditions as we craft dishes that warm the heart and bring the vibrant tastes of Korea to California. Whether you’re flying solo, pairing up with your Valentine or gathering with friends, this class is all about learning and connecting—one bite at a time. Anne Han, owner of Winnie Superette in Nevada City, will guide us through a live cooking demo featuring two irresistible (and vegan) dishes:Tteokbokki – chewy rice cakes simmered in a flavorful sauceMini Kimbap – rice-based rolls wrapped in seaweed and filled with goodnessAfter the demo, you’ll get to savor these iconic Korean street food favorites. Did we mention that each attendee will receive a delicious drink upon arrival? 건배!

title: Karaoke - Grass Valley Brewing Co.
description: It’s Karaoke Night at GVBC with DJ Kenn!

title: Motion Theater
description: With Minica Farbiarz and Evan Specter. We have decades of exploration as performers, teachers of autobiographical, physical, embodied storytelling.

title: Warren Haynes Solo - Winter of Warren 2026
description: Visionary GRAMMY Award-winning artist Warren Haynes is a cornerstone of the American music landscape, lauded as one of the most formidable guitarists and vocalists of the modern era and a prolific songwriter and producer. He effortlessly cross-pollinates genres and unfurls solos that broil with passion in his distinctive, signature style., Throughout his prolific career as part of three of the greatest live groups in rock history – Allman Brothers Band, Gov’t Mule and the Dead – and an acclaimed solo artist, he has become one of music’s most treasured storytellers and his artistry has led to thousands of memorable performances and millions of album and track sales.

title: Much Ado About Nothing
description: Directed By: Robert J. PetersonAdapted By: Robert J PetersonOne of Shakespeare’s greatest comedies, MUCH ADO ABOUT NOTHING follows a pair of long-feuding lovers, Benedick and Beatrice, as they trace a winding course back into each others’ arms. Meanwhile, a young couple, Claudio and Hero, plans their own marriage, only for a bitter rival, Don John, to thwart their intentions. Thankfully the local law, Dogberry and the watch, work the case and set things right. This production resets the action to 1979 New Orleans, presenting the play in a new adaptation that harvests dialogue from around the Elizabethan era. Old fans and newcomers alike should delight in this surprise-filled production. kespeare’s greatest comedies, MUCH ADO ABOUT NOTHING follows a pair of long-feuding lovers, Benedick and Beatrice, as they trace a winding course back into each others’ arms. Meanwhile, a young couple, Claudio and Hero, plans their own marriage, only for a bitter rival, Don John, to thwart their intentions. Thankfully the local law, Dogberry and the watch, work the case and set things right. This production resets the action to 1979 New Orleans, presenting the play in a new adaptation that harvests dialogue from around the Elizabethan era. Old fans and newcomers alike should delight in this surprise-filled production. FEATURING:Benedick: Jed DixonBeatrice: Trish AdairDon Pedro: Philip LoringLeonato: John GardinerSister Antonia: Stephanie Raczkowski Margaret: Tina Marie KelleyClaudio: Amber BusseHero: Margot RoaDogberry: Micah ConeVerges: Molly WingerdSeacole: Emma JilesenOtecake: Meghan PetittDon John: Ehrland HollingsworthBorachio: Harrison McCormickContrade: Audrey DelgadoBarkeep/Sexton: Greg Flagg

title: Creative Capital | Cultivating Community with ASiF - Artists’ Studio in the Foothills Exhibition
description: By partnering with ASiF, this exhibition takes a behind-the-scenes look at just one of the many makers’ spaces that make Nevada County a thriving arts ecosystem—by providing access to a network of resources and relationships within the community. Celebrate ASiF’s community and learn more about the powerful impact these creative hubs have within our Cultural Districts, east and west., Art in Public Spaces is a program of Nevada County Arts Council, presented in partnership with the County of Nevada., Exhibition: September 12, 2025 - February 17, 2026, Opening Reception: Friday, September 19th at 4:30pm, Where: The Eric Rood Administrative Center - 950 Maidu Ave, Nevada City

title: Mobilize | Art Inspiring Activism with Wild & Scenic Film Festival Exhibition
description: Mobilize is the first exhibition of 2026 under Art in Public Spaces and celebrates a 15-year partnership between Nevada County Arts Council and Wild & Scenic Film Festival. title: Poetry Open Mic
description: Bring your favorite poem to share. Maybe you wrote it, maybe someone else did, but it resonated with you. Maybe you found it at just the right time ~ so feel free to share that story in a safe and welcoming place., Suggested donation $10 each meeting. No one turned away ~ Wheelchair access available., ***Please park in the rear of the Veteran's Memorial parking lot, 255 S. Auburn St, and use the path to the center.

title: Hearts on Fire. Show Your Love—Be Wildfire Ready.
description: Hearts on Fire!Save the date for a first-of-its-kind event where you can SHOW YOUR LOVE for Nevada City, Firewise Communities, and all of Nevada County by becoming Wildfire Ready Together.Enjoy live music, great food, interactive “Show Your Love” art, and engaging fire stories. The event is jointly hosted by the Wildfire Ready Coalition of Nevada County and the Nevada City Office of Emergency Services as part of a Neighbor-to-Neighbor grant—a program of California Volunteers, Office of the Governor.This will also serve as a fundraiser for the volunteer-driven Wildfire Ready Coalition. Let’s come together to make our community—and ourselves—ready for wildfire. Resilient in the face of fire. Built to withstand the blaze.

title: Sweetheart Family Dance
description: Celebrate your Sweetheart!! Come join us for an evening of dancing and fun! There will be food and beverages for sale. A few guided dances through out the evening from some fun talented instructors. All proceeds go to the Schoolhouse.

title: Cars and coffee grass valley
description: Cars and coffee grass valley is a weekly car event at daily donuts in the Mcknight crossing shopping center every saturday morning from 7 to 10

title: STEAM Exploration Saturdays
Hands ON! Second Saturday
description: Estelle J. Kelsey Foundation Hands ON! Second Saturdays offers monthly free admission, hands-on art activities, storytelling, a docent-guided tour, live performances, and community collaborations. “Art Expeditions” provides children the opportunity to engage with Museum staff and take a closer look at current work on view. New exhibitions, community collaborations, guest performances and monthly themes rotate in this engaging series of monthly programs. , This month’s “Love in the Lunar New Year” theme is inspired by the performance by Little Swan Dancers, highlighting the Lunar New Year.

title: Watercolor Exploration with Chappy Valente
description: Immerse yourself in the expressive world of watercolor painting! Whether you’re brand new to watercolor or looking to expand your skills, this hands-on class with artist and educator Chappy Valente will help you gain confidence and technique. Learn to paint with fluidity and intention as you explore the tools, papers, and brushwork that make watercolor such a luminous and rewarding medium., Each session is a stand-alone class with fresh projects and techniques—join once or come monthly to continue growing your watercolor practice., What’s the Project:, Create your own watercolor studies exploring washes, color mixing, and texture effects. Each class introduces a new focus—such as landscapes, botanicals, or abstract forms—to inspire your creativity., What Will They Learn:, Brush control and paint-to-water ratios, Wash techniques (wet-on-wet, wet-on-dry, gradient), Paper types, brush styles, and pigment selection, Layering, and color blending, Tips for composition and adding expressive detail, Materials Needed:, All materials are provided for in-class use. Students are welcome to bring their own favorite brushes or watercolor set if desired., Skill Level / Prerequisites:, All skill levels welcome—from first-time painters to those continuing their watercolor journey., Class Length: One 3-hour session, (Optional continuing classes offered monthly), Fee: $50 + $20 materials, Minimum 3 / Maximum 6 participants

title: Nevada City Winery Flame-Kissed Valentine’s Day
description: Susan Watson and Ian Garfinkel come together as a wonderful folk/rock duo. Both performing vocals as well as guitar, their upbeat feel-good live performance is something you won’t want to miss.Pyrography artist Carrie Fender will be on-site, demonstrating and teaching live wood-burning. Guests can create a personalized message burned into a piece of functional art—an unforgettable keepsake or heartfelt gift. Price range: $15–$42 Plus, indulge in a special wine & chocolate pairing, created just for Valentine’s Day.

title: Love Lounge
description: Love Lounge is a Valentine’s Day gathering designed for connection, music, and being fully present—held in one thoughtfully curated space.Doors open at 6:00pm for arrival and mingling. Programming begins at 6:30pm with an opening Rose Ceremony, followed by romantic DJ sets by Ruby Chase and Deva Runa, a live acoustic Medicine Sessions performance featuring Tete Bero, Angelina Oka, and Michael Gazzo, and a series of gently curated moments designed to invite warmth, ease, and connection throughout the evening.Enjoy hand-rolled sushi by Chef Ned, craft mocktails by Soulspace, and the Red Lotus Lounge by Monrosia, featuring red lotus tea—an ancient botanical traditionally associated with relaxation and heart-opening qualities. Local vendors will be woven throughout the space, offering moments of discovery and connection.Hand-rolled sushi will be freshly prepared on-site with vegan, cooked, and traditional options available.This is a full Valentine’s experience—one place to arrive, stay awhile, and enjoy the night without needing to go anywhere else.Come solo, with a close friend, or with your beloved.This gathering is welcoming to singles and couples of all genders and orientations.Sushi RSVP InfoTo ensure availability, guests who plan to enjoy sushi are invited to reserve their spot with a $15 per-person sushi deposit, which will be applied toward their sushi order the night of the event. This helps our chef plan ahead and reduce waste.After purchasing your event ticket, you’ll receive a follow-up email with a link to reserve your sushi and place the deposit.Menu available at soulspacecollective.org/loveloungeEvent DetailsFriday, February 14Soulspace — 206 W Main St, Grass ValleyDoors: 6:00pmProgramming: 6:30pm–11:00pmTickets• $30 Presale• $35 at the door• $15 Sushi RSVP add-onFood & drinks sold separately

title: Cupid’s Cabaret: A Valentine’s Golden Gala
description: Truth or Dare Productions PresentsCupid’s Cabaret: A Valentine’s Golden Gala, This Valentine’s Day, romance meets rebellion as Cybil Unrest and Truth or Dare Productions present Cupid’s Cabaret: A Valentine’s Golden Gala, an immersive burlesque experience celebrating love, community, and golden-era glamour., Taking place Saturday, February 14, this one-night-only event transforms the beloved Golden Era Lounge into a glittering cabaret fantasy infused with modern edge and playful seduction.Wrapped in the lush, vintage elegance of Golden Era Lounge, Cupid’s Cabaret blends old-Hollywood sparkle with contemporary burlesque heat. Audiences can expect dazzling showgirls, cheeky satire, and intimate performances that blur the line between cabaret nostalgia and bold modern expression., “This night is more than just a show — it’s an experience,” says producer and host Cybil Unrest, founder of Truth or Dare Productions. “Burlesque has always been about joy, wit, community, and freedom of expression, and Cupid’s Cabaret brings all of that together in one unforgettable Valentine’s celebration., Event Highlights Include:, -Decadent golden-era–inspired burlesque performances from a lineup of sensational performers, -Two burlesque show sets with your one ticket at 8:00 PM and 9:00 PM — no two shows are alike, -A pre-show Lounge Party (6:00–8:00 PM) open to the public with no ticket required, -A special one-night-only “Truth or Dare” cocktail crafted exclusively by Golden Era Lounge, -A post-show Music Bar Party (9:30 PM–Midnight) featuring soundscapes by DJ BackPalm (Nick Fedoroff), open to the public, The evening is designed as a full Valentine’s experience, encouraging guests to arrive early, stay late, and enjoy every layer of the night — from cocktails and dancing to intimate, up-close burlesque performances. With Golden Era Lounge’s warm, historic atmosphere and famously excellent sightlines, there truly isn’t a bad seat in the house.VIP tickets offer premium front-row seating and enhanced interaction with performers, though availability is limited and expected to sell out quickly. General seating is also limited, reinforcing the intimate nature of the event., Beyond romance, Cupid’s Cabaret celebrates love in all its forms, romantic, platonic, chosen family, and community. The event is proudly LGBTQ+ friendly, welcoming all identities and orientations., Schedule at a Glance:, 6:00–8:00 PM — Lounge Party (No Ticket Required), 8:00 PM — First Burlesque Show Set (Ticket Required), 9:00 PM — Second Burlesque Show Set (Ticket Required), 9:30 PM–12:00 AM — Music Bar Party with DJ BackPalm (No Ticket Required)A limited number of door tickets may be available for walk-ups (cash or Venmo only), though advance purchase is strongly encouraged as the show historically sells out., Cupid’s Cabaret: A Valentine’s Golden Gala promises a sultry, celebratory night filled with laughter, glamour, and unforgettable live entertainment — a Valentine’s experience rooted in artistry, inclusivity, and joy.For tickets and more information, follow Truth or Dare Productions and Golden Era Lounge on social media, or go to Truth or Dare Productions .com

title: Woodturning 101 – Craft a Beautiful Wooden Bowl
description: Are you interested in woodturning and looking to learn a new skill? In this class, you’ll learn how to turn a beautiful bowl out of wood using a lathe. The process is both rewarding and relaxing, as you take a piece of raw wood and turn it into a functional work of wood art. Under the guidance of our experienced instructor, you’ll start by learning the basics of wood lathe operation and safety. Once you’re comfortable with the equipment, we’ll move on to selecting and preparing the wood for turning. With the wood secured on the lathe, you’ll use a series of specially designed tools to shape the bowl. , At the end of the class, you’ll take home a beautiful, hand-turned bowl that you can be proud of. You’ll also have the woodturning skills and knowledge to continue turning bowls on your own. , Price: $160 + $40 materials, Limited spaces available. Sign up today! Class 2 minimum/3 maximum participants – (please note: if attendance does not meet minimum, class will be rescheduled) , Tools provided. If you have tools, please feel free to bring them.

title: American Piano Awards Winner: Michael Davidman presented by InConcert Sierra
description: Michael Davidman, American Piano Awards Winner, February 15, 2026 ∙ 2pm, with 1:15 pre-concert forum, Davidman is the grand prize winner of the 2025 American Piano Awards and the prestigious Christel DeHaan Fellowship. He was awarded $25,000 and will also receive over $200,000 in career support, including two years of artist management and public relations services, a media tour, a residency at the University of Indianapolis, a recording contract with the Steinway & Sons label, and numerous performance opportunities both in the United States and abroad., Following his remarkable performance of Sergei Rachmaninoff’s Piano Concerto No. 3 in D minor, Op. 30, Davidman was awarded first place in the competition. As the top prize winner (the 50th winner of the competition since it began 1979), he will also embark on a recital tour during the 2026–27 season, along with concert engagements with the American Piano Award’s partners, including the Phoenix Symphony, Santa Fe Symphony Orchestra, Tucson Symphony Orchestra, Buffalo Philharmonic Orchestra, Indianapolis Symphony Orchestra, and chamber recital with InConcert Sierra., A graduate of the Curtis Institute and Juilliard, Davidman is currently studying with Stanislav Ioudenitch at the Reina Sofía School of Music in Madrid. He is a winner of the Long-Thibaud International Piano Competition, the Juilliard Gina Bachauer Competition, and the Ithaca College of Music Piano Competition, and has performed as a soloist with the Philadelphia Orchestra, Orchestre Symphonique de la Garde Républicaine, Symphonicity, and the Monterey Symphony.

title: Nevada City Winery Live Music with Adeline Wood
description: Adeline fell in love with the guitar at 11 when she stole her brother's arch top that only had 3 strings on it! That love continues to this day and has blossomed into building her own guitars and playing instrumental Blues, Bossa Nova, and Hawaiian Slack Key.

title: Punch-Drunk Love
description: Struggling to cope with his erratic temper, novelty-toilet-plunger salesman Barry Egan (Adam Sandler, demonstrating remarkable versatility in his first dramatic role) spends his days collecting frequent-flier-mile coupons and dodging the insults of his seven sisters. The promise of a new life emerges when Barry inadvertently attracts the affection of a mysterious woman named Lena (Emily Watson), but their budding relationship is threatened when he falls prey to the swindling operator of a phone sex line and her deranged boss (played with maniacal brio by Philip Seymour Hoffman). Fueled by the careening momentum of a baroque-futurist score by Jon Brion, the Cannes-award-winning PUNCH-DRUNK LOVE channels the spirit of classic Hollywood and the whimsy of Jacques Tati into an idiosyncratic ode to the delirium of new romance.

title: Spring Street Swing Out
venue_name: Odd Fellows Hall, 212 Spring Street, Nevada City CA 95959
description: 🎶 Get Ready to Swing the Night Away! 💃🕺, Join us for our monthly Swing Dance & Lindy Hop Night – a high-energy evening filled with music, movement, and community fun!, 🕕 Intro Lesson: 6–7 PM – Perfect for beginners! No experience or partner needed., 🎉 Social Dance to follow – Dance the night away with fellow swing lovers!, 💵 Tickets:, • $10 – DJ Nights (6pm-9pm), • $15 – Live Band Nights (6pm-10pm), 🎓 Students: $5 off with valid ID!, Beer and Nevada City Winery wine available for purchase., 🎷Check our calendar for upcoming live band nights and special events:, 👉 nevadacountyswings.org, Whether you're stepping onto the dance floor for the first time or you're a Lindy pro, there's a spot for you. See you there!

title: Joss Stone
description: Wednesday, February 18, 2026, Doors: 6pm | Show: 7pm, The Center for the Arts | 314 W. Main Street, Grass Valley, CA, Tickets: Reserved Seating, Genre: R&B, Joss Stone is a Grammy and Brit Award-winning artist who released her acclaimed debut album, The Soul Sessions, in 2003, at the age of 16. Over her career, she has released ninestudio albums, selling over 15 million copies worldwide. Stone has performed and collaborated with legendary artists including James Brown, BurtBacharach, Stevie Wonder, Gladys Knight, Sting, Van Morrison, Melissa Etheridge, Jeff Beck, Mick Jagger, and Damien Marley, amassing over one billion streams in the US alone.In 2014, she completed her audacious Total World Tour, performing and collaborating withlocal artists and charities in every country in the world.Her 2022 release, Never Forget My Love, was her eighth studio album, written with and produced by Eurythmics’ Dave Stewart, with whom she also co-wrote music and lyrics for the West End musical The Time Traveller’s Wife. In 2023, Stone embarked on her "20 Years of Soul" anniversary tour, during which she recorded her first live album, 20 Years of Soul - Live in Concert. She followed this with the Ellipsis Tour in 2024. Her latest single, "Loving You," was released on August 9, 2024. Stone is currently working on a new studio album, scheduled for release in 2025.

title: The Doo-Wop Project
description: The Doo Wop Project brings the classic sounds of vocal harmony into the 21st century. Featuring stars from Broadway hits like Jersey Boys, Motown, and Beautiful, this supergroup takes audiences on a journey from the golden age of street-corner harmonies to modern hits “Doo Wopified” with their signature style. With a PBS special, four albums, and sold-out shows worldwide, The Doo Wop Project delights every generation with music that’s timeless and fresh.

title: Needle Felting Creations: Mingle & Make
description: Mingle & Make – Needle Felting Creations, Unwind, get creative, and enjoy a relaxed evening of making at our Mingle & Make: Needle Felting Creations class! Whether you’re brand new to needle felting or a seasoned crafter, this social, hands-on workshop invites you to explore color, texture, and form while creating your own whimsical felted project to take home., Come solo or bring a friend to share the fun—snacks and beverages included! Bring a friend and receive a $5 off coupon toward your next class., Price: $35 + $10 materials fee per person, No experience necessary, Class 6 minimum/11 maximum participants – (please note: if attendance does not meet minimum, class will be rescheduled)

title: Motion Theater
description: With Minica Farbiarz and Evan Specter. We have decades of exploration as performers, teachers of autobiographical, physical, embodied storytelling.

title: NU Dance 25th Annual Student Choreography Showcase
description: Nevada Union High School’s Theatrical Dance program proudly presents the 25th annual Student Choreography Showcase on Thursday, February 19th through Saturday, February 21st at 7:00 p.m. at the Don Baggett Theater, 11761 Ridge Road, Grass Valley. Twenty student choreographers have created dances in a variety of styles, taught to their peers in after-school and weekend rehearsals. Junior Tabby Gillespie is choreographing for the first time this year, and she chose “Benny and the Jets” by Elton John. Reflecting on her song choice, Gillespie said, “I want to share a positive vibe with the audience, conveying that dance doesn’t need to be taken so seriously. I wanted to choreograph this piece because dance has always been a place where I can be myself and has shaped me as a person.” Senior Eryn Miller has been in the Advanced Dance class for all four years of high school, and this is her third year choreographing for Showcase. This year, she is choreographing two dances: one for the intermediate class and one for a group of her advanced peers. Her advanced piece is a tribute to her grandmother, who passed away a few years ago. She titled her piece, “For Grammy,” explaining, “I will forever know the love she felt for my dancing and the pride she felt when I stepped on stage. I dance not just for myself, but to feel the everlasting love she had for my dance. I know she would be proud of the young dancer I am becoming. I want to honor her memory and give thanks to who she was.” Junior Charlotte des Tombe composed an original song for her dance, combining her love for dance as well as songwriting. Her piece explores the theme of coping with loss, and she titled her song as well as her dance “Blue Eyes.” Senior Advanced Dancer and Theatrical Dance Club President, Annie Armstrong, choreographed two dances for this show: one for a Beginning Dance class, and one for Advanced. Both of her dances reflect her transition from childhood to adulthood and her experiences over the past four years in the NU Dance Program. In her choreography proposal, Armstrong wrote, “This program has been like a home to me, and I am grateful for my friends and the connections I have made here.” This annual production is an audience favorite. It began as a senior project twenty-four years ago, when current dance teacher, Courtney Wadman, was a senior in the advanced dance class. Wadman, along with some of her fellow dancers, wanted to create a production of student works, so under the guidance of their teacher Yelena Holt, the Student Choreography Showcase became an annual tradition. Tickets are $15 and all seating is reserved. Tickets can be purchased online at www.nevadauniondance.com…. Online sales close at 10:00 a.m. the morning of the performance to prepare the box office. Remaining tickets will be sold at the box office, cash or check only, beginning 2 hours before each performance. For additional information, contact the Nevada Union Dance Department at (530) 273-4431 ext. 2103 or email nuhsdance@gmail.com.

title: Mobilize | Art Inspiring Activism with Wild & Scenic Film Festival Exhibition
description: Mobilize is the first exhibition of 2026 under Art in Public Spaces and celebrates a 15-year partnership between Nevada County Arts Council and Wild & Scenic Film Festival. This year’s festival theme and title of the Rood Center exhibition, MOBILIZE, serves as a call to action and a celebration of progress toward tangible change. The exhibition explores Wild and Scenic’s rich history and its visual art exhibition, utilizing visual language to elevate voices, organize efforts, and address environmental challenges.

title: Cars and coffee grass valley
description: Cars and coffee grass valley is a weekly car event at daily donuts in the Mcknight crossing shopping center every saturday morning from 7 to 10

title: STEAM Exploration Saturdays
Community Game Day at North Star House
description: Community Game Day was so much fun that we put another date on the calendar! Come hang out at the historic North Star House on February 21st from 1-4pm where there will be board games, card games, and plenty of room to connect, laugh, and have fun.

title: Sound Blessings With Robin
venue_name: Inner Path, 300 Commercial Street, Nevada City, CA
description: Join in a magical sound experience created from crystal singing bowls, voice and other instruments. Your personally requested blessing will be infused into the sound. Lay back, relax and float on the vibrations.

title: Nature Infused Bookmaking Journey
description: Handcrafted Journals & Storybooks Using Natural Materials and Time-Honored Binding Techniques, Slow down, work with your hands, and create something meaningful., In this multi-session workshop, participants will explore the art of handmade bookmaking using fine art paper, handmade papers, natural materials, fabric, leather, collage, and traditional binding techniques. We’ll begin with small, playful book forms, move into nature-inspired bindings, and culminate in a beautifully stitched Artist Journal or Artist Storybook., This workshop blends artisan craft with gentle guided creative exploration, offering a welcoming space to quiet the mind through introspection and hands-on making. Books become containers for story, memory, and creative intention — pieces you can continue working in long after the class ends., No previous bookbinding experience is required. All materials are provided., What you’ll create:, 2–3 small handmade books using folded and pre-bound structures, 1–2 nature-inspired bound books, A final Artist Journal or Artist Storybook using sewn binding techniques, Format:, 4–session series | 3 hours per session, Class Size: 6–10 participants, Session Fee: $245 + Materials Fee: $45

title: Nature Infused Bookmaking Journey
description: Handcrafted Journals & Storybooks Using Natural Materials and Time-Honored Binding Techniques, Slow down, work with your hands, and create something meaningful., In this multi-session workshop, participants will explore the art of handmade bookmaking using fine art paper, handmade papers, natural materials, fabric, leather, collage, and traditional binding techniques. We’ll begin with small, playful book forms, move into nature-inspired bindings, and culminate in a beautifully stitched Artist Journal or Artist Storybook., This workshop blends artisan craft with gentle guided creative exploration, offering a welcoming space to quiet the mind through introspection and hands-on making. title: Flameworking Everything Marbles
description: Lampworking: Everything Marbles!, Small spheres. Big satisfaction., Are the kids still playing marbles and jacks? Maybe… maybe not—but in this class, marbles take center stage. Everything Marbles! is a playful, hands-on lampworking workshop where participants of all ages and experience levels learn the fundamentals of making beautiful, handmade glass marbles on the torch., This class is all about building strong foundations while having fun. You’ll explore how molten glass gathers, moves, and responds to heat and gravity as you shape, color, and finish your own unique marbles. Along the way, we’ll also demystify the annealing process and why it’s essential to creating strong, finished glass pieces., Whether you’re brand new to lampworking or looking to expand your skills, this class offers a welcoming entry point into torchwork—and a great way to start (or grow) a marble collection made entirely by you., What You’ll Create, Clear glass marbles, Outside-color marbles, Inside-color marbles, What You’ll Learn, Basic heat control on the torch, Gathering and shaping molten glass, Applying color inside and outside the marble, Gravity and marvering techniques, How to use a marble mold, An introduction to annealing and the cooling process, Class Details, Skill Level: All levels welcome (no prior experience required), Format: One hands-on workshop, Ages: Adults & Teens 12 +, Class Size: Small-group instruction for personalized guidance, Materials: All glass and tools provided, Please wear natural fiber clothing (cotton, wool, etc.), Bring a snack and water for break time, Price: $75 class fee + $30 materials, Perfect for curious beginners, young makers, and anyone who loves small-scale glass magic, Everything Marbles! is a fun, approachable way to experience lampworking while creating timeless glass treasures—one marble at a time.
